content.description: Start on two opposing 1/4 pad crimps and move up to a cool vertical rail finishing straight up to the lip.

Start on the same hold as for Taïga - the crimp-ish ledge right in the middle of the Boreal boulder and minimal feet. Move straight up to right hand crimp to come to stand on start hold. Technical moves to top out to the right of the tree.Might make it a grade harder if you're short or have a short wingspan.

Napping Caribou - beta video



Boreal boulder. On main path in the far right lower stacks passed the chamber.

pads. good landing
Start left hand on the right start hold of "Crimps and grits," and right hand on a undercling seem to the right. Climb right and up to the lip through crimps.

Start bat hang in the divot just by the point, hand matched in the great pocket underneath. 

Where the name comes from:

The Stó:lō /ˈstɔːloʊ/, alternately written as Sto:lo, Stó:lô, or Stó:lõ and historically, as Staulo or Stahlo, and historically known and commonly referred to in ethnographic literature as the Fraser River Indians or Lower Fraser Salish, are a group of First Nations peoples inhabiting the Fraser Valley and lower Fraser Canyon of British Columbia, Canada. Stó:lō is the Halqemeylem word for "river". The Stó:lō are the river people.

This is to pay respect to the people that were on this land before us.

The slight modification in the spelling is simply referencing to the low height of the boulder.





Right end of the boreal boulder.

Far right lower stacks passed the chamber. 

pads

Start matched on the crimpy flake that's pretty much right in the middle of the face of the giant boulder (Boréal Boulder). Move left then straight up. High ball-ish

Taïga - beta video

comment what you think the grade is on this?

Taïga (/ˈtaɪɡə/; Russian: тайга́, IPA: [tɐjˈɡa]; relates to Mongolic[1] and Turkic[2] languages), generally referred to in North America as boreal forest or snow forest, is a biome characterized by coniferous forests consisting mostly of pines, spruces, and larches. The taïga or boreal forest is the world's largest land biome.

It's also the name of my son.

right on the main path. walk passed the chamber and keep left. it's in the far right lower stacks. Big wall, you can't miss it.
pads
Giant Boulder in the lower right stacks. 3 problems so far (Sept.7th 2020)
